definition: to make a determined effort
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
indignant/anger/resentment
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)

sentences.english: For my own shortcomings and introspection, will in the face of a setback to jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 为自己的不足而自省，才会在挫折面前发愤努力。

sentences.english: After his last loss in a match, he determined to improve himself and regain the championship finally.
sentences.chinese: 上次比赛失利后，他发愤图强，总算重新夺冠。

sentences.english: Joy is like the people's wings make one fly, while sorrow drives one diligent.
sentences.chinese: 欢乐是人们的双翼，哀愁是使人发愤的动力。

sentences.english: Some of the students were so immersed in their studies that they sometimes even forgot their meals.
sentences.chinese: 有的学生有时候甚至发愤忘食。

sentences.english: We make every effort to ensure that there are no errors in the text or in the code.
sentences.chinese: 我们尽最大发愤确保文中和代码中没有过错。

sentences.english: We will try to make this your best Mother"s Day ever."
sentences.chinese: 我们将发愤使今天成为您过得最愉快的母亲节。

sentences.english: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.
sentences.chinese: 或者可以激动我骨肉之亲发愤，好救他们一些人。

definition: to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to start reading furiously, contrary to previous habit (idiom)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
hardworking/assiduous
lit. with his head attached to a beam and stabbing his thigh with an awl (idiom)/fig. to study assiduously and tirelessly
pinyin: tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3

definition: to study assiduously and tirelessly (idiom)/see also 頭懸梁，錐刺股|头悬梁，锥刺股[tou2 xuan2 liang2 , zhui1 ci4 gu3]
to write a book
to encourage oneself
to study hard/assiduous
to be determined/to be resolved
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to lie on firewood and taste gall (idiom); fig. suffering patiently, but firmly resolved on revenge
preparatory literary studies for imperial examination
